head.title: Weddings; Cara A. Testa, Peter Conniff

hedline.hl1: Weddings; Cara A. Testa, Peter Conniff

block.p: Cara Augusta Testa, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Rene B. Testa of Demarest, N.J., was married yesterday to Peter Martin Conniff, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Conniff of Brooklyn. The Rev. Kenneth J. Boller, the president of Xavier High School in New York, performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at St. Joseph's Church in Demarest.

Mrs. Conniff, 25, graduated from Barnard College and is a candidate for a master's degree in international affairs at Columbia University, where her father is a professor of civil engineering. Her mother, Joan Testa, teaches prekindergarten at St. Joseph's School in Demarest.

Cara Augusta Testa, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Rene B. Testa of Demarest, N.J., was married yesterday to Peter Martin Conniff, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Conniff of Brooklyn. The Rev. Kenneth J. Boller, the president of Xavier High School in New York, performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at St. Joseph's Church in Demarest.

Mrs. Conniff, 25, graduated from Barnard College and is a candidate for a master's degree in international affairs at Columbia University, where her father is a professor of civil engineering. Her mother, Joan Testa, teaches prekindergarten at St. Joseph's School in Demarest.

Mr. Conniff, 29, graduated from Fordham University. He is an international operations manager at Merrill Lynch & Company in San Francisco. His mother, Margaret S. Conniff, teaches mathematics and religion to fourth, fifth and sixth graders at St. Frances Cabrini School in Brooklyn. His father is a partner in Cusack & Stiles, a New York law firm.
